Class SharedResource

java.lang.Object
java.util.AbstractCollection<Resource>
java.util.AbstractList<Resource>
java.util.Vector<Resource>
WorkLoad.SharedResource
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Cloneable, Iterable<Resource>, Collection<Resource>, List<Resource>, RandomAccess, SequencedCollection<Resource>
public class SharedResource extends Vector<Resource>
Represents a pool of identical resources that can be locked by Jobs.

A SharedResource contains multiple Resource instances and maintains bookkeeping such as the set of tasks that may access the resource, a priority-inheritance waiting queue (PIPQueue), and the number of currently idle resource instances. It is used by the simulator to manage lock/unlock operations, resource creation and protocol-specific behavior (e.g., MSRP/global detection).

Inline comments in the original file indicate this class is used by MSRP detection (isGlobal) and that Resource objects are created and assigned IDs when createResources(int) is invoked.

Author:
ShiuJia

  • Constructor Details

    • SharedResource

      public SharedResource()
      Constructs a new SharedResource instance.

  • Method Details

    • createResources

      public void createResources(int n)
      Create and add n Resource instances to this pool.

      Each Resource receives a sequential ID starting at 1 and a back-reference to this SharedResource. The idle resource counter is initialized to n.

      Parameters:
      n - the number of Resource instances to create

    • addAccessTask

      public void addAccessTask(Task t)
      Register a Task as an accessor of this shared resource.
      Parameters:
      t - the Task that may access the resource

    • setLock

      public void setLock(Job j, CriticalSection cs)
      Attempt to lock a free Resource for the given Job and mark it with the specified critical section end time.

      The method iterates resources in the pool and assigns the first free Resource it finds to the Job. The resource's relative end time is set from the critical section, and the job is recorded as having locked that resource. The idle resource count is decremented.

      Parameters:
      j - the Job acquiring a lock
      cs - the CriticalSection describing the lock duration

    • setUnlock

      public void setUnlock(Job j)
      Release resources locked by the specified Job.

      All Resource instances whose Resource.whoLocked() equals j are unlocked and the idle resource counter is incremented.

      Parameters:
      j - the Job releasing locks

    • releasePIPQueueJob

      public void releasePIPQueueJob()
      Clear the priority-inheritance (PIP) waiting queue.

    • addJob2PIPQueue

      public void addJob2PIPQueue(Job j)
      Add a Job to the priority-inheritance (PIP) waiting queue.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job to enqueue

    • getWhoLockedLastResource

      public Job getWhoLockedLastResource(Job j)
      Return the last locked resource's owner whose current core equals the provided Job's current core. This helps resolve ownership when mixing local/global resources.
      Parameters:
      j - the Job used to compare the owner core
      Returns:
      the Job that locked the most recently used resource on the same core, or null

    • setIsGlobal

      public void setIsGlobal()
      Mark this shared resource as global when tasks that access it are located on different cores (MSRP detection heuristic).

      The method examines the task set and sets the isGlobal flag if more than one local core is involved or if a task has no local core.

    • isGlobal

      public boolean isGlobal()
      Return whether this resource is considered global (MSRP usage).
      Returns:
      true if global, false otherwise

    • showInfo

      public void showInfo()
      Print debug information about this SharedResource and its access set.

    • setID

      public void setID(int id)
      Set the integer identifier for this SharedResource.
      Parameters:
      id - integer id to assign

    • getID

      public int getID()
      Return the integer identifier for this SharedResource.
      Returns:
      the resource ID

    • getPIPQueue

      public Vector<Job> getPIPQueue()
      Return the PIP waiting queue as a Vector of Jobs.
      Returns:
      the PIPQueue vector

    • getResource

      public Resource getResource(int i)
      Return the Resource at the given index within the pool.
      Parameters:
      i - index of the resource
      Returns:
      the Resource instance

    • getResourcesAmount

      public int getResourcesAmount()
      Return the number of Resource instances in this pool.
      Returns:
      the pool size

    • getAccessTaskSet

      public TaskSet getAccessTaskSet()
      Return the set of Tasks that may access this SharedResource.
      Returns:
      the TaskSet of accessing tasks

    • getIdleResourceNum

      public int getIdleResourceNum()
      Return the currently idle resource count.
      Returns:
      number of free resources

    • getLeftResourceAmount

      public int getLeftResourceAmount()
      Count and return the number of currently free Resource instances.
      Returns:
      the count of resources not currently locked
